meanings.definition: A person who seeks to undermine the power or authority of an established system or institution.
meanings.sent1: The subversives plotted to overthrow the government.
meanings.sent2: The authorities were on high alert for any subversives in the city.
meanings.sent3: The group of subversives tried to prank the principal by switching all the classroom chairs.
meanings.sent4: The subversives were like shadows, quietly eroding the foundation of the organization.
meanings.sent5: The subversives' whispers of dissent echoed through the halls, stirring up unrest.

meanings.definition: Actions or activities intended to overthrow or undermine a government or political system.
meanings.sent1: The subversives' plans to disrupt the election were thwarted by the authorities.
meanings.sent2: The history books were filled with tales of subversives attempting coups.
meanings.sent3: The subversives' attempt to replace all the flags with silly ones was quickly discovered.
meanings.sent4: The subversives' influence spread like wildfire, igniting rebellion in the hearts of the people.
meanings.sent5: The subversives' actions were like a storm, shaking the very core of the nation.
